embeds.title: Premonition
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 1 (0) :e_hexa: / The Hexaghost / Downfall

Choose a card in your hand.
Play the chosen card and **Exhaust** it.
**Exhaust**.

messages.content: Havoc but in the hand instead of top of draw pile
also a lot better
with afterlife synergies and whatnot

It's pretty sweet with the right afterlife cards, burning question and ghost shield are particularly strong. The upgrade helps a lot to smooth out it's effectiveness, as it can be pretty awkward to spend 1 energy to play a card that would only have cost 1 energy in the first place (especially if that card didn't have afterlife). You can also pair it with particularly expensive cards, like the rare that lights up all the ghostflames, or 5th and 6th seal. You will normally want some extra card draw, or runic pyramid to help line premonition up with the best possible targets, otherwise it will feel inconsistent. Also very strong with dead branch, where you are guaranteed to generate 2 new cards for 1 or 0 energy. I wouldn't necessarily take this without some of those synergies though, because it can be very low impact when drawn alongside generic cards.
Also, I think something is up with the poll, it won't let me submit a vote
honestly i think this is best with burning question and perhaps hexaguard, ghost shield doesn't get you two blur so it's not that great
Yeah same
I think it is a relatively low priority upgrade, due to the nature of afterlife hexa doesn't have energy problems as bad as other characters
its great with Specters Wail for 16 (22?) damage aoe
<Specter's Wail>

embeds.title: Specter's Wail
embeds.description:
Common Attack / 1 :e_hexa: / The Hexaghost / Downfall

**Ethereal**. **Afterlife.**
Deal 8 (11) damage to ALL enemies.

messages.content: yeah it's 16(22)

busted. Plays your 3 cost powers for 1 energy or lets you get double uses out if the afterlife cards. Hexaghost has more card draw post update too so its even easier to play this. I think hexaghost always takes runic pyramid every time its offered and this obviously really good there (as well as on snecko eye; anther relic that can break a hexaghost run in half)
Wait hexa takes pyramid? Since when?
Afterlife is an anti-synergy, and ghost shield spam means you don't really need to be precise when it comes to block
how is afterlife an anti synergy
literally anyone takes pyramid its the best relic in the game
You have enough energy to just play all your cards more often than not, so if you save your cards all it means is you didn't spend your energy.
Pyramid is best for being able to have on demand block. Blur achieves that too.
I guess you could say you can save your attacks for being on the right ghostflame, but that's not really extremely impressive. It might make bolstering spam easier too.
But I think hexa as a character probably takes advantage of it the least.
1/3 of hexa's pool is ethereal and unaffected

pyramid's weakness is getting your hand clunked up. But afterlife cards play themselves preventing that issue; letting you really easily control what you retain. Hexaghost also needs less energy then other characters so theres much less of a opportunity cost of taking pyramid vs an energy relic. Lastly hexaghost has a LOT of situational cards that you really benefit from retaining.
in general downfall characters just go crazy when they get pyramid. Besides snecko and sometimes hermit you just take it nearly every time and it wins the game.
What situational cards are there? All I can think of is saving premonition for powers.
Also with pyramid, that is an extremely bad anti synergy with haunted hand

and other than haunted hand (which we just established isn't a good synergy) hexa has almost no ways of getting rid of status cards, the only 2 I can think of being <worthy sacrifice> and <premonition>

embeds.title: Worthy Sacrifice
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 0 :e_hexa: / The Hexaghost / Downfall

**Exhaust** a card.
If it was Attack or Skill, gain a random card of the opposite type. ( It costs 1 less.)

embeds.title: Premonition
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 1 (0) :e_hexa: / The Hexaghost / Downfall

Choose a card in your hand.
Play the chosen card and **Exhaust** it.
**Exhaust**.

messages.content: and for a character who is somewhat slow at dealing damage, that is problematic

Off of the top of my head. All advance and retract cards. Catch up, charged Barrage, bright ritual, heat crush, incorporeal (that ones huge), , unleash spirits, turn it up, unlimited power, step through, premotion and searing wound. these cards all noticeably get much stronger when you can time them at any point you want during the fight.
like can keep <searing wound> and use it right before your soul burn expires to get the most damage out of the card

embeds.title: Searing Wound
embeds.description:
Rare Skill / 1 :e_hexa: / The Hexaghost / Downfall

ALL enemies lose HP equal to their Soulburn.
~~- **Exhaust**. -~~

messages.content: Cards based on the amount of ghost flames you have ignited can be used for their maximum value consistently. Cards that need intensity can be played after you have built intensity up first (catch up, unlimited power). Like a quarter of the card pool gets so much better with just one relic
haunted hand is really bad with pyramid, but thats just a single card and its really the only one you desperately don't want.
oh <phantom fireball> I've never ever taken this card without pyramid support; but with that relic it feels viable.

embeds.title: Phantom Fireball
embeds.description:
Common Attack / 0 :e_hexa: / The Hexaghost / Downfall

Deal 4 (7) damage.
If the enemy has Soulburn, detonate it.

messages.content: I think the advance and retract ones are alright, catch up, charred barrage and bright ritual yeah, heat crush I have only ever taken if I see IC3 as my boss. Incorporeal yeah that one is huge, unleash spirit just don't play it on your first deck cycle, turn it up just kinda sucks no matter how you play it from my experience, unlimited power's best use case (from what I've seen) is to just end hallway fights, since even with no intensity its still 36 damage 8 soulburn and 4 block and 1 strength, and it has insane multipliers on intensity (+10 damage, +2 soulburn, and +1 block per intensity). Despite that, I've only really used it to clear hallways, may try it out some more. Step through is weird, since a ton of card draw on pyramid isn't always that necessary. Premonition gets a decent amount from it, and so does searing wound. Maybe I've underestimated this relic on hexa.
Also yeah now looking at it, unlimited power being 3 cost is insane.
<unlimited power>

embeds.description:

**Exhaust**.

not crazy
